ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the sun and moon are fused together,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the sun and moon are conjoined,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and the sun and the moon are joined together,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and the sun and the moon are brought together,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the sun and the moon will be united.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And the sun and moon will be joined together.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the sun and the moon are brought together,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and the sun and moon are brought together,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And sun and moon are united,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: when the sun and the moon are brought together,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the sun and the moon shall be joined.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and the sun and the moon are brought together,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And the sun and moon are joined together,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And the sun and moon will be joined together (by going one into the other or folded up or deprived of their light, etc.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: when the sun and moon are gathered together
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the sun and the moon are joined together.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the sun and the moon are joined,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:9] and the sun and the moon are brought together, so that both of them will rise from the west; or [it means   when] the light of both of them disappears — and this will be on the Day of Resurrection —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And sun and moon are united) like two black, horned bulls whose hooves are beaten and then are thrown in the veil of light,
